data.question: Implementing a derived attribute always means creating both setters and getters methods.

comments.comment: Implementing a derived attribute usually means that we need to create getXXX methods. In rare cases also setXXX.

data.question: One way to achieve extent persistence is to save it to a file.

comments.comment: Class extent can be persisted eg in a disk file.

data.question: Business applications do not need extent persistence.

comments.comment: The vast majority (all of them?) of business applications must ensure data persistency.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The method storing a single object should, as a parameter, accept a stream. This way, you can save a lot of data to one stream.

data.question: The method storing all extents should accept the file name as a parameter.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The method storing all extents should accept the file name as a parameter. This will allow them to be stored in a single file.

data.question: The problem of extent persistence related to links is due to the poor performance of the Java platform.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The problem of extent persistence, related to relationships, is caused by potential multiple retention of the same data.

data.question: One of the ways to effectively maintain links between objects is to use references.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: For effective persistence, variable references should be replaced with fixed identifiers.

data.question: In order to improve performance, each extent should be serialized into a separate file.

data.question: Hashtable is one of several possible classes that can store a lot of extents in Java.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Hashtable is one of the Map interface implementations that is convenient for storing multiple extents.

data.question: Association is an instance of a link.

comments.comment: Link is an instance of an association (the same as an object is an instance of a class).

data.question: Association describes a link.

comments.comment: The association describes a link (similarly as a class describes an object).

data.question: Correctly defined cardinalities reduce the risk of making an error.

comments.author: Samuele Milan

data.question: Implementing an association with IDs provides better performance than using references.

comments.author: Samuele Milan

data.question: The most efficient way to implement a qualified association is to replace ArrayList with Vector.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Search performance can be improved using a map, not a simple collection e.g. Vector.

data.question: One way to improve the performance of a qualified association is to replace ArrayList with Hashtable.

data.question: Return links make it easy to meet your business requirements.

data.question: Associations in the superclass are not inherited.

data.question: The concrete class may contain both abstract and concrete methods.

comments.comment: Specific classes may contain only specific classes.

data.question: In the abstract class there can be both abstract and concrete methods

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In the abstract class there can be both abstract and concrete methods.

data.question: The method override may exist without the polymorphic method call.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Theoretically, the overriding may exist without a polymorphic call, but its usefulness would be rather limited.

data.question: Polymorphic calls to methods can exist without overriding methods.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Conversely, the polymorphic call of the method can not exist without overriding (because there would be no alternative method to call).

data.question: In inheritance overalpping object can belong to several classes at once.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: As defined, the overalpping inheritance can belong to several classes at once.

data.question: Thanks to the use of composition instead of inheritance we have easy access to inherited invariants.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Unfortunately, the introduction of compositions made it difficult to access invariants (because they are not 'automatically' inherited).

data.question: When replacing the overlapping inheritance with a composition, we need to implement it with inner classes.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The composition can be implemented in any way - it does not always mean using inner classes.

data.question: In Java, interfaces can directly serve to define object attributes, firstName.

comments.author: Samuele Milan

data.question: The operation propagation causes the business code of the method to be in a single place.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Thanks to the propagation of the operation, the business code is located in one method, and the rest of the code only calls it.

data.question: Multi-aspect inheritance is the same as multi-inheritance.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Multi-aspect inheritance is different from multi-inheritance.

data.question: Multi-aspect inheritance occurs in all popular programming languages.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Multi-aspect inheritance does not occur in any of the popular programming languages.

data.question: The simplest way to implement multi-aspect inheritance is to flatten the hierarchy.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Flattening of the hierarchy is the easiest way to implement any kind of inheritance (including multi-aspect).

data.question: Implementing multi-aspect inheritance one of the aspect should be implemented using a "real" inheritance of a given programming language.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Wherever possible, we use 'real' inheritance to use its facilities.

data.question: The simplest way to implement dynamic inheritance is to flatten the hierarchy.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Flattening of hierarchy is the easiest way to implement any kind of inheritance (including dynamic).

data.question: Flattening of the hierarchy should be combined with the addition of the discriminator.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Adding a discriminator is a necessary requirement when flattening the hierarchy (so we know the 'type' of an object).

data.question: Implementing a dynamic inheritance based on a composition should use the {or} constraint.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: We should use the {xor} constraint (because {or} allows two connections at a time).

data.question: The most precise way to write constraints is the natural language.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Unfortunately, natural language is one of the least restrictive ways of defining constraints

data.question: In practice, no constraints are used because everything can be expressed as a "standard" notation.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, usually you can not express all system requirements with standard notation.

data.question: The constraints in Java use the special constraint keyword.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: There is no constraint keyword in Java.

data.question: The basic principle used to implement constraints is to create public attributes and private methods.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The basic principle used to implement constraints is to create private attributes and public methods (not vice versa)

data.question: Declaring constants in constraints is a good practice.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: By using the declared constants, we can easily change them in one place in the future.

data.question: Implementing {unique} with the class attribute Set will improve performance at the expense of memory.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The Set container will speed up the search, but of course it will take extra memory.

data.question: Implementing {unique} using the extent reduces memory consumption at the expense of performance.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The second approach will work (significantly) slower, but without consuming extra memory.

data.question: The {subset} implementation requires a method to check for the existence of a given link.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: One of the basic activities that needs to be done is to check the existence of a particular link.

data.question: The {subset} constraint holds the associations in a fixed order.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Using {subset} does not affect the order of links.

data.question: The {ordered} implementation requires a method to check for the existence of a given link.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Implementation {ordered} does not require checking the existence of the specified link.

data.question: By using {ordered}, we can store duplicate links.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Constraint {ordered} does not affect the ability to store duplicates.

data.question: Implementing {bag} requires a method that checks for the existence of a given link.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The {bag} constraint allows you to store any object, so you do not need to check for the existence of any links.

data.question: By using {bag} constraint we can store duplicate links.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The {bag} constraint allows you to store any links (including duplicates).

data.question: Implementing {xor} requires a method to check the existence of a given link.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The constraint {xor} ensures that there is only one link at the same time, so it needs to verify the existence of the given link.

data.question: By using {xor} we can store duplicate links.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The constraint {xor} does not specify the uniqueness of the related objects.

data.question: Relational model is popular because of the richness of its structure.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: There are not many constructs in the relational model.

data.question: Relational databases for sure will be replaced by object-oriented.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: At the moment it is difficult to judge which technology/concept will replace the relational solutions.

data.question: Relational model uses the concept of object identity.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The identity concept of an object exists in an object model, not a relational one.

data.question: One of the basic relational model concepts is the primary key and the foreign key.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indeed, one of the basic relational model concepts is the primary key and the foreign key used to model the connection.

data.question: Indexes increase the speed of all operations in the database.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indexes increase the speed of performing certain operations in a database (eg, search). On the other hand, they usually slow down updates.

data.question: The explosion of popularity of web applications has contributed to the popularization of databases.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Most web applications use databases.

data.question: The impedance mismatch is due to the poor performance of databases

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Impedance mismatch is not related to performance.

data.question: The impedance mismatch does not occur when you create a system entirely on the database side.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Actually, when dealing with only one model, there is no impedance mismatch.

data.question: Classes are mapped to relational tables.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In fact, classes are mapped to relational tebels.

data.question: Simple attributes are directly mapped to columns in the table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Simple attributes are directly mapped to columns in the table.

data.question: The primary key is a combination of several columns of text type that provides better performance than a single-column numeric key.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In most cases, the greatest performance is provided by a single (large) number key.

data.question: The primary key is used to identify a specific tuple.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: According to the assumptions of the relational model, the primary key is used to identify a particular tuple.

data.question: Simple attributes are implemented in RM as columns in the table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indeed, simple attributes are implemented in RM as columns in the table.

data.question: Complex attributes can be implemented in RM as a separate table with a foreign key.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: One way to implement complex attributes is to use an external table with the foreign key.

data.question: Optional attributes must be implemented as a separate table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The easiest way to include optional values is to allow NULL in the table column.

data.question: The manadatory attributes are implemented as a column allowing NULL value.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The required attributes are implemented as a column that does not allow null (and not vice versa).

data.question: One way to implement a repetitive attribute is to store its value in a text field.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: This is a acceptable solution, but not very good.

data.question: One way to implement repetitive attributes is to store values ​​in a separate table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Thanks to this solution we have convenient access to individual values.

data.question: The best way to implement a class attribute is to define it on the programming language side without worrying about data persistency.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: This approach is incorrect because it does not ensure the sustainability of business data (the value can change).

data.question: The class attribute can be written to a dedicated table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: This is one possible solution.

data.question: Derived attributes can be implemented as a special type of column in a regular table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Relational model does not give such an opportunity.

data.question: The database view allows us to define, for example, the age of a person calculated on the basis of the date of birth.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: This is the most feasible in modern BD.

data.question: Every database makes it easy to define methods in tables.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Defining methods in tables is not a standard feature of a relational model.

data.question: Each database makes it easy to define class methods in tables.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Defining class methods in tables is not a standard feature of a relational model.

data.question: Associations of 1:1 cardinality can be realized with a foreign key.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Associations of 1:1 cardinality can be created with a foreign key. On the other hand, for such values, you might want to consider merging two tables.

data.question: Association 1:* can be realized with a foreign key.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Association 1:* can be stored with a foreign key. Of course, with such numbers, it is not possible to merge two tables.

data.question: Associations *:* can be accomplished using an intermediary table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The only way to accomplish card. * - * is to use an intermediary table.

data.question: You can add two primary keys and 4 foreign keys to avoid entering the intermediate table.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, the only way to achieve an association with an attribute is to introduce an intermediary table.

data.question: Introducing an intermediary table facilitates understanding of business rules.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Unfortunately, the introduction of the 'obfuscate' intermediate table: we have an extra table on a diagram that looks identical to the other tables, making it difficult to analyze the model.

data.question: A design that is close to a qualified association can be implemented by selecting the correct primary and the foreign keys.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: One way to 'simulate' a qualified association is to use a qualifier as a key.

data.question: The primary purpose of using a qualified association is to speed up the search for connected objects.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indeed, the primary task of a qualified association is to speed up the search for connected objects.

data.question: Implementation of aggregation and composition in RM is based on similar assumptions as for Java.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: As in the case of Java, the implementation of aggregation consists in providing a link (association) and a composition on the completion of specific rules.

data.question: It is worthwhile to use built-in DB mechanisms such as triggers.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Triggers allow certain actions to be performed automatically by DB. They may, for example, be in line with the rules of composition.

data.question: In the classical relational model there are all kinds of inheritance except overlapping.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In the classical relational model, inheritance does not occur.

data.question: One way to implement inheritance in RM is to flatten the hierarchy.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Flattening the heirarchy is one way to accomplish any kind of inheritance.

data.question: API libraries were designed exclusively for working with DB.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: API (Application Programming Interface) means any application programming interface, such as database, GUI, graphics.

data.question: JDBC technology makes it easy to write portable (between different BDs) applications.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: One of the basic assumptions of JDBC is to provide a unified way of working with any DB.

data.question: The main reason for using ORM tools is to improve the performance of BD access.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The basic premise of ORM is to make it easier (transparent) to work with any data source.

data.question: ORMs, to some extent, suppress the impedance mismatch.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: ORMs do not completely eliminate impedance mismatches but significantly reduce them.

data.question: The biggest advantage of LINQ is the efficiency of accessing databases.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The main purpose of LINQ is not to improve performance, but to facilitate working with data sources (collections, DB, XML, JSON, etc.).

data.question: One version of LINQ allows you to work with native .NET collections.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indeed, there is LINQ2Objects, created for working with native .NET collections.

data.question: The @OneToMany annotation is used to map the association.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indeed, the @OneToMany annotation is used to map the association.

data.question: When working with Hibernate, you need to create and update the DB schema manually.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Fortunately, Hibernate manages the database schema itself by creating the appropriate tables and connections.

data.question: Transforming a directed association into a bidirectional one requires, among other things, adding dedicated constructs on the Java side.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In order to convert the association to bidirectional, we actually need to add the appropriate collection on the Java side.

data.question: The data schema for the directed and bidirectional association is identical.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Indeed, the data scheme for directed and bidirectional association is identical.

data.question: Implementing multi-valued attributes with Hibernate is no different than the implementation of the association.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The Hibernate library provides a special tag (element) to implement multi-valued attributes.

data.question: The @ElementCollection annotation is used for the implementation of multi-valued attributes.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The @ElementCollection annotation is used for the implementation of multi-valued attributes.

data.question: The most important in the application is functionality, and the interface is a minor add-on.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, creating an application should pay attention to both the functionality and the interface to support it.

data.question: It is very easy to measure the quality of the interface.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Interface evaluation is dependent on many factors, including tastes, habits. Therefore, it is quite difficult to carry out.

data.question: Usability of interfaces is an interdisciplinary issue.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Interdisciplinary is a term that concerns several disciplines. Of course the GUI belongs to this category.

data.question: One of the most important aspects of usability is the practical usefulness of the thing/service.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Practical application is an important assessment factor.

data.question: One of the basic elements facilitating shaping usability is frequent contacts with users.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Contacts with your users let you know their GUI feedback and, accordingly, make corrections.

data.question: Usability can be shaped in complete isolation from the users.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: It is difficult to shape product usability (GUI) without knowing user feedback.

data.question: You do not have to watch your users during the usability tests - just listen to their comments.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: User comments may be misleading. Therefore, it is important to observe their behavior.

data.question: It is worth doing usability tests for very large user groups.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Large user groups repeatedly report the same errors. For this reason, it is better to conduct more frequent tests with smaller teams.

data.question: The usability level presented by the application has no impact on user productivity.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, the usability of the interface has a huge impact on users.

data.question: Before you start your own design work, you should test your competitor solutions.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: By testing competitive solutions, we can avoid making mistakes.

data.question: Instead of creating a consistent GUI design, it is better to include a comprehensive manual.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Users do not like to read manuals. Therefore, let's try to design a GUI so that it is not needed.

data.question: Modern monitors are large, so you do not have to worry about proper window space management.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Precisely because of the varying screen sizes, scaling techniques should be considered.

data.question: Checklists should be included with each interface project.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Checklists allow you to avoid common mistakes and therefore should be used when designing.

data.question: All platforms have identical interface requirements.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Each platform has its own interface requirements. Their inclusion will make it easier for users to use applications.

data.question: The interface design should include information about scaling controls.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: According to the usability guidelines, a GUI project should take into account information about window scaling and its contents.

data.question: The interface design may contain information about the type of controls.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, the designer should also include the types of controls for displaying different types of data.

data.question: Manual GUI implementation is the fastest way to implement it.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Manually implementing a GUI usually gives you the best results, but it's not the fastest way to accomplish it.

data.question: Using graphical editors accelerates the GUI creation process.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The graphical editor allows you to design and test the interface quickly.

data.question: The only significant criterion for choosing a GUI library is its price.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course there are many important criteria (eg performance, portability, price, capabilities) of library selection for GUI creation.

data.question: The criterion of cross-platform is not always relevant.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: If we do the system on one platform, the cross-platform criterion may be omitted.

data.question: The Swing library is currently (still) the most popular desktop application development solution for Java.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In fact, Swing is currently the most popular desktop application development solution for Java. This is because it is integrated with the platform.

data.question: The SWT library is always faster than Swing.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: In some situations the SWT library is faster than the Swing ('drawing' component), but in others the slower ('converting' the data to a form acceptable by native controls).

data.question: The workload needed to create your own GUI library is comparable to that required for existing modification.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Modifying an existing library is a lot simpler than creating your own from scratch.

data.question: Creating your own GUI library requires first of all the ability to work at a high level of abstraction.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Creating your own GUI library requires working on a fairly low level of abstraction (operating system events).

data.question: Adding String instead of objects to the control decreases the performance of the application and increases the required developer workload.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, adding String instead of objects to the control decreases application performance and increases the developer's workload. This is because the object needs to be converted to text and subsequently searched for in the extent.

data.question: Using the dedicated listener for handling controls improves code readability.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Dedicated listeners mean we have smaller pieces of code to manage and understand.

data.question: The programmer, in all circumstances, should use only one distribution manager.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Layout managers should be selected according to needs. Moreover, it often happens that in the same window, we use several different layouts.

data.question: All the controls we refer to in the code should have the correct names given.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Of course, in order for the program to be readable, references in the source code to controls should have meaningful names - often with a specific convention.

data.question: Moving calculations to a separate thread can improve user interface performance.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The best way to solve this problem is to move the calculation to a separate thread.

data.question: The SwingWorker class displays the default version of the progress bar.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: The default implementation of the SwingWorker class does not contain any GUI elements.

data.question: Using the SwingWorker class speeds up execution of calculations about 3 times.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Using the SwingWorker class is intended to improve GUI performance, rather than speeding up computation.

data.question: The ProgressWorker class displays the progress bar.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: One of the improvements to the ProgressWorker is to add a progress bar.

data.question: The ProgressWorker class just like SwingWorker supports interrupting the operation.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Both classes: ProgressWorker and SwingWorker have support for interrupting the operation.

data.question: Declarative GUI creation is an absolute novelty and no commercial company provides such capabilities.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: There are several commercial implementations of declarative GUIs, such as XAML.

data.question: Semantic declarations make it possible to work on a higher level of abstraction than a component.

comments.author: Samuele Milan
comments.comment: Semantic declarations use a data model, not GUI controls. For this reason, we can talk about a higher level of abstraction.
